The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] 2. **Draw 2D sketch on face_1** Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. **Create lines for loop\\_1 in face\\_1** Draw lines on the sketch to form a loop as follows: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.375, 0.5] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.375, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] * line\\_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Close the loop** Close the loop by connecting the end of `line_5` to the start of `line_1`. 5. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 units along its normal direction. Part 2: Cylindrical hole Create a cylindrical hole in the center of the prism. 1. **Create coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.25, 0.0, 0.125] 2. **Draw 2D sketch on face\\_1** Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. **Create circle for loop\\_1 in face\\_1** Draw a circle on the sketch as follows: * Center: [0.125, 0.125] * Radius: 0.125 4. **Close the loop** This step is not required since there's only one circle in the sketch. 5. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.25. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 units in the opposite direction of its normal.</description>

Set the operation to create a new solid body. Part 2: Cylindrical Object Middle Section Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90, 0, -90] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.15, 0] Draw a 2D sketch on the YZ plane of the coordinate system. Create two circles in the sketch, centered at (0.225, 0.225) and (0.225, 0.3375) with radii of 0.225 and 0.0375, respectively, forming a central hole. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.45. Transform the scaled sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0, 0, 0] - Translation Vector: [0, 0, 0] Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.1875 units, creating the middle section of the cylindrical object. Set the operation to join this new part with the previously created base, adding material to the object. Final Shape: Tapered Cylindrical Object The final shape consists of the base and middle section, forming a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, a slightly tapered middle section, and a central hole. The object has a reflective surface and appears to be made of a shiny material. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units (from the base to the top of the middle section) - Width: 0.75 units (diameter of the base) - Height (thickness): 0.225 units (base thickness) and 0.1875 units (middle section thickness)</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Creating the Base Rectangular Prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Now, create a sketch with a single face (face\\_1) using the coordinate system. On this face, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of the following lines: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.5, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.5, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] Proceed with extruding the sketch along the normal direction by 0.3 units with a scaling factor of 0.75, creating a rectangular prism. Make sure to use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation", effectively making this the base part. **Part 2: Creating the First Cut to Form the Hole** Create a new coordinate system for this part with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.3] Based on this coordinate system, draw a face and add a loop (loop\\_1) made up of these lines: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.15, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.15, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.15 units towards the opposite direction of the normal. This will create a second rectangular prism matching the size and position of the first part, but cutting into it due to the opposite extrusion direction. Use the "CutFeatureOperation." **Part 3: Creating the Central Cylindrical Hole** Create a new coordinate system for this part with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.225, 0.275, 0.3] Draw a circular sketch with a radius of 0.1 at the center [0.1, 0.1] on this plane. Apply "CutFeatureOperation" with an extrusion depth of 1.25 units in the opposite direction of normals. Ultimately, the overall shape will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. **Final Shape Detailed Properties** The final shape will be composed of three parts. * Part 1: A rectangular prism with flat top and bottom faces, dimensions 0.75x0.75x0.3 * Part 2: A disjointed and thinner rectangular prism with flat top and bottom faces, 0.75x0.75x0.15 * Part 3: A cylindrical hole with a diameter of 0.2 and a height of 1.25, centered and penetrating through the entirety of the shape</description>
